kw.name: Connect To Database
kw.msg: Connect to DB using : pymysql.connect(db='sistema_dos', user='aaron', passwd=***, host='127.0.0.1', port=3307, charset='utf8mb4')
kw.doc: Creates a database connection using the DB API 2.0 ``db_module`` and the parameters provided. Along with listed commonly used arguments (`db_name`, `db_host` etc.) you can set any other DB module specific parameters as key/value pairs.

test.name: Base crear tabla

kw.name: Execute Sql String
kw.msg:
Executing sql:
CREATE TABLE `personas3` (`id` int(11) NOT NULL,`name` varchar(40) NOT NULL,`ap` varchar(40) NOT NULL);
kw.arg: CREATE TABLE `personas3` (`id` int(11) NOT NULL,`name` varchar(40) NOT NULL,`ap` varchar(40) NOT NULL);
kw.doc: Executes the ``sql_string`` as a single SQL command.

kw.name: Log To Console
kw.doc: Logs the given message to the console.

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Strings
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to strings.
